p: There is suggestion that derangement of liver function should be taken into consideration alongside other physiological values [ 11, 30]. Patients with SARS-CoV-2 have exhibited increased levels of creatine kinase, lactate dehydrogenase, ferritin, C-reactive protein, and myoglobin alongside liver dysfunction, and it has been suggested that liver damage is collateral, caused by induced cytotoxic T cells and the induction of the innate immune response rather than direct injury from the virus itself, as observed with other respiratory viruses [ 11, 16, 30, 45].
